name: scatter_prior
text: Here we can see 50 samples generated by a gaussian process with a certain covariance function (with a periodic kernel, in fact, but that doesn't matter now). Like before, we have fixed regions in the x axis, for which we sample random heights.

name: linear_prior
text: Like before, the points are sampled from a gaussian process. If you imagine that we get a huge, almost infinite number of points, you can imagine those as being almost like the graph of a function. Here, u is the mean and Ïƒ is the standard deviation of this random function.

name: posterior
text: When you add or remove a point, the the mean and the confidence interval of the estimated function are updated. Additionally, selecting different kernels allows you to observe how different assumptions about the function influence the shape of the prediction.
